ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.2_0: At that time Venerable Belaṭṭhasīsa, Venerable Ānanda’s preceptor, was staying in the wilderness.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.3_0: After walking for alms, he brought plain boiled rice back to the monastery, where he dried and stored it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.4_0: Whenever he got hungry, he moistened it and ate it. As a consequence, he only re-entered the village for alms after a long time.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.6_0: “Why do you only re-enter the village for alms after such a long time?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.8_0: “But do you eat food that you’ve stored?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.10_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.11_0: “How can Venerable Belaṭṭhasīsa eat food that he has stored?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.12_0: “Is it true, Belaṭṭhasīsa, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.15_0: “... Belaṭṭhasīsa, how can you eat food that you have stored?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.16_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.17_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:1.18.1_0: ‘If a monk eats staple or non-staple food, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.6_0: received today and eaten on the following day.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.8_0: apart from the five staple foods, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics, the rest is called “non-staple food”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.10_0: there are five kinds of staple food: cooked grain, porridge, flour, fish, and meat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.11_0: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.1.12_0: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.1_0: If it has been stored, and he perceives that it has, and he eats the staple or non-staple food, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.2_0: If it has been stored, but he is unsure of it, and he eats the staple or non-staple food, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.3_0: If it has been stored, but he does not perceive that it has, and he eats the staple or non-staple food, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.4_0: If she receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.5_0: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.6_0: If it has not been stored, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.7_0: If it has not been stored, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.2.8_0: If it has not been stored, and he does not perceive that it has, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.3.2_0: if he stores and eats it during the right time;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.3.3_0: if he stores and eats post-midday tonics during the remainder of the day;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.3.4_0: if he stores and eats seven-day tonics during the seven-day period;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.3.5_0: if he uses lifetime tonics when there is a reason;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc38:2.3.8_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on storing, is finished.
